body_html:
I downloaded http://central.maven.org/maven2/org/tensorflow/tensorflow-android/1.8.0/tensorflow-android-1.8.0.aar

unpacked tensorflow-android-1.8.0.aar

renamed unpacked classes.jar to tensorflow-android-1.8.0.jar and moved it to app\libs
renamed unpacked jni folder to jniLibs and moved it to app\src\main

removed implementation 'org.tensorflow:tensorflow-android:+' from gradle file

added implementation files('libs/tensorflow-android-1.8.0.jar') to gradle file

now this problem is gone

this is so weird:)
body_text:
I downloaded http://central.maven.org/maven2/org/tensorflow/tensorflow-android/1.8.0/tensorflow-android-1.8.0.aar
unpacked tensorflow-android-1.8.0.aar
renamed unpacked classes.jar to tensorflow-android-1.8.0.jar and moved it to app\libs
renamed unpacked jni folder to jniLibs and moved it to app\src\main
removed implementation 'org.tensorflow:tensorflow-android:+' from gradle file
added implementation files('libs/tensorflow-android-1.8.0.jar') to gradle file
now this problem is gone
this is so weird:)
body:
I downloaded http://central.maven.org/maven2/org/tensorflow/tensorflow-android/1.8.0/tensorflow-android-1.8.0.aar

unpacked `tensorflow-android-1.8.0.aar`

renamed unpacked `classes.jar` to `tensorflow-android-1.8.0.jar` and moved it to `app\libs`
renamed unpacked `jni` folder to jniLibs and moved it to `app\src\main`

removed `implementation 'org.tensorflow:tensorflow-android:+'` from gradle file

added `implementation files('libs/tensorflow-android-1.8.0.jar')` to gradle file

now this problem is gone

this is so weird:)
